msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; the name of the king, donor and scribe; a few groups of lines (alternating with black lines) in the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-2; the number and the incipit of the miracles; the word ʾǝsäggǝd “I worship” or some letters of this word in Text I-1; two initial lines of the supplication in fol. 128r; a few words in fol. 6ra; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

msItem.note: - Text I-1 is divided into strophes with a crude line, in modern pen.
- The scribe began the numbering from Text I-2 and continued up to miracle 36 on fol. 58ra. Some numbers do not follow the sequence.

- The first part of Text I-2 is divided into two sections. The second section is introduced with the word mǝʿǝraf “chapter” on fol. 6rb. The second part of Text I-2 is introduced with the word mǝʿǝraf “chapter”. It is divided into two sections. The second section, introduced with the word mǝʿǝraf “chapter”, begins on fol. 10rb.
- Most of the miracles are introduced with the words mǝʿǝraf “chapter” and/or täʾamǝr “miracle”, täʾamrihu “his miracle” and nägär “speech”. A few miracles have no particular introducing word.

Fol. 128vb: Donation note. Fol. 148ra: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘጐይታይ፡ ብላታ፡ እምኖቱ[sic]፡ ስመ፡ አቡሁ፡ ገብረ፡ ጻድቅ፡ ወእሙ፡ ወለተ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ወብእሲቱ፡ ወለተ፡ መድኅን፡ ወደቂቁ፡ ወለተ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ዓመተ[sic]፡ ማርያም፡ ገብረ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ወለተ፡ ኪዳን፡ ወለተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ለታቦተ፡ መድኃኔ፡ ዓለም፡ ጨሐት፡ ከመ፡ ይኲኖ፡ መርሐ፡ ለመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት
The note is written in a hand not much posterior to the main hand, the same which has added the names into the supplication formulas. It states that the book belongs to gwäytay blatta ʾƎmnotu who donated it to the church of Mädḥane ʿAläm of Ḉäḥat. Also, the names of his family members are mentioned: his father Gäbrä Ṣadǝq, his mother Wälättä Gäbrǝʾel, his wife Wälättä Mädḫǝn and his children Wälättä Mikaʾel, ʾAmätä Maryam, Gäbrä Ḥawarya, Wälättä Kidan and Wälättä Śǝllase. ʾƎmnotu is the same person as Gäbrä Dǝngǝl (s. the colophon).

- The scribe rubricated the text after he completed the writing in black ink. This is evident from the fact that often the rubricated nomina sacra and other names are shortened to fit the blank, e.g., ማርያም: is abbreviated to ማርያ: (fol. 13va) and ኢየሱስ: to ኢየሱ: (fols. 14rb, 29ra, 39ra, 43ra, 43vb). - Spaces for the rubrics have been left empty in some fols. (e.g., fols. 45rb, 57va, 58ra). - Omitted letters, words or passages are inserted interlineally, in a small script: fols. 60vb, 61ra, 64va, 70rb, 71ra, 72vb, 87ra, 128rb. - Pen trial: fols. 19va. - Minor notes, writing exercises, doodles: fols. 1v, 2rv, 11va, 125vb, 128v, 129v.

person.persName: According to Additio 1, gwäytay blatta ʾƎmnotu donated the Ms. to the church of Mädḥane ʿAläm of Ḉäḥat. In the colophon, ʾƎmnotu is referred to with his baptismal name Gäbrä Dǝngǝl. This same name has been written over erasure or added interlineally in most of the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. Also, the names of his family members have been added. All names have been written in a secondary hand, the same as Additio 1.
The original owner was Gäbrä Ḥǝywät whose name has been erased from the colophon and from most of the supplication formulas but retained on some fols., e.g., 41rb, 43ra, 46rb, 47rb, 50rb, 78rb.
